item.title: Error =p
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

[quote=“xXx JAVA OWNZ U xXx, post:16, topic:162854”]Maby this?

case 4: // regular chat
chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
chatTextSize = (byte)(packetSize-2);
if(muted == 1) {
sendMessage(“You can’t talk because you are muted!”);
}
else if(muted == 0) {
inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
String playerchat = “[”+playerName+"]: “+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2)+”";
GHOST.newmsgfromplayer = “[”+playerName+"]: “+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2)+”";
//println_debug(“Text [”+chatTextEffects+","+chatTextColor+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2));

 }

			break;[/quote]

Is that switch statement inside your commands method? If not, stfu and do what I said.

Read full topic

item.title: Error =p
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:5, topic:162854”]Oh and btw…

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5) { if(muted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell!"); } else { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+": "+command.substring(5); GHOST.newmsgfromplayer = "["+playerName+"]: "+command.substring(5)+""; } }

Correct way.

Lescape look at code, that would be 3 ending brackets and 1 starting…[/quote]

WRONG FAGGOT.
The command is inside a method, therefore you need another closing brace.

if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5) { if(muted == 1) { sendMessage("You are muted and cannot yell!"); } else { PlayerHandler.messageToAll = playerName+": "+command.substring(5); GHOST.newmsgfromplayer = "["+playerName+"]: "+command.substring(5)+""; } } }

Will work.

Read full topic
